ground_truth: She is flipping through a book by a curtained window. Lee puts the book she's been holding down on the desk, only to pick up another one. She looks at the offscreen Elliot and reacts. The camera moves to a blushing Elliot, following him now as he walks across the room. As Lee speaks, Elliot parts a hanging curtain against the wall to reveal a stereo and some records. He looks at the offscreen Lee. As Elliot reaches inside the stereo shelf, grabbing a bottle of antihistamines, the camera moves back to Lee, who sits down on the bed. She is still holding a book. Elliot walks over to Lee; he sits down on a footstool in front of her. She chuckles; Elliot smiles and chuckles with her. Hannah, eating a carrot stick, enters the bedroom. The camera stays with her momentarily as she walks towards Elliot and Lee. Holly laughs, and Lee glances over to her, reacting. Hannah, embarrassed, reacts and sits with her hands on her face. They look at Evan, listening. Hannah, embarrassed, makes a victory sign. Lee and Holly try to suppress their laughter. Norma glares at them. Elliot wraps his arm around Hannah; he pulls her towards him affectionately and kisses her on the cheek. She hugs him back. Mavis the maid exits, carrying some trays, as the group starts to cheer and applaud. Holly waves her napkin at April, then holds up her wine glass. The group continues to cheer as they all toast Hannah. She reacts, smiling but embarrassed. The guests, sipping their wine, quiet down as Norma continues to speak. Lee and Holly unsuccessfully try to contain their laughter. Mavis reenters the dining room to serve more food to the children. Norma toasts her daughter; everyone follows her. The applause and cheers begin anew. Hannah, reacting, chuckles. Hannah tenderly takes Elliot's hand as she looks around the table. He, in turn, kneads her shoulder, chuckling with equal tenderness. Hannah, still embarrassed, looks down at a plate. The group applauds once more, toasting and drinking, and warmly sounding their approval. Classical string music plays as the film cuts to a taxi moving down Broadway towards the camera, passing a truck on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, and several buildings, and as the taxi moves offscreen, the classical music still playing, the movie cuts to the taxi's backseat. Lee sits by the window, leaning her head in her hand, a reflective look on her face. Lee stirs a cup of coffee on the counter of the loft's modern kitchen area; a nearby vase holds flowers. She walks across the loft, with its high ceilings and beige walls, holding her coffee. Lee continues to walk, past a modern chaise, a bookcase, some sofas, and two columns.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She is leafing through a tome by a draped casement. Lee places the tome she's been clutching down on the countertop, only to lift another one. She peers at the offscreen Elliot and reacts. The lens shifts to a flushed Elliot, trailing him now as he strides across the chamber. As Lee utters, Elliot parts a suspended drapery against the partition to unveil a sound system and some albums. He glances at the offscreen Lee. As Elliot reaches inside the sound system rack, seizing a vial of antihistamines, the lens shifts back to Lee, who perches down on the berth. She is still clutching a tome. Elliot strides over to Lee; he perches down on a footrest in front of her. She giggles; Elliot grins and giggles with her. Hannah, munching a carrot stick, enters the sleeping area. The lens remains with her briefly as she ambles towards Elliot and Lee. Holly chuckles, and Lee peeks over to her, reacting. Hannah, abashed, reacts and perches with her palms on her visage. They glance at Evan, listening. Hannah, abashed, forms a victory gesture. Lee and Holly attempt to stifle their mirth. Norma glowers at them. Elliot enfolds his arm around Hannah; he draws her towards him lovingly and kisses her on the cheek. She embraces him back. Mavis the housemaid departs, bearing some trays, as the assembly starts to cheer and acclaim. Holly flutters her napkin at April, then elevates her goblet. The assembly continues to cheer as they all toast Hannah. She reacts, grinning but abashed. The invitees, sipping their goblet, quiet down as Norma continues to speak. Lee and Holly unsuccessfully attempt to contain their mirth. Mavis reenters the dining chamber to serve more fare to the offspring. Norma toasts her offspring; everyone follows her. The acclaim and cheers commence anew. Hannah, reacting, giggles. Hannah gently takes Elliot's hand as she glances around the board. He, in turn, massages her shoulder, giggling with equal gentleness. Hannah, still abashed, peers down at a dish. The assembly acclaims once more, toasting and imbibing, and warmly sounding their endorsement. Classical string harmonies play as the motion picture cuts to a cab moving down Broadway towards the lens, passing a lorry on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, and several structures, and as the cab moves offscreen, the classical harmonies still playing, the motion picture cuts to the cab's backseat. Lee perches by the casement, resting her cranium in her palm, a pensive expression on her countenance. Lee stirs a mug of java on the worktop of the loft's contemporary cooking area; a nearby vessel holds blooms. She strides across the loft, with its lofty ceilings and beige partitions, clutching her java. Lee continues to stride, past a contemporary chaise, a bookcase, some sofas, and two pillars.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A book is being flipped through by her by a curtained window. The book that Lee has been holding is put down on the desk by her, only for another one to be picked up. The offscreen Elliot is looked at by her, and she reacts. Elliot, now blushing, is followed by the camera as he walks across the room. As Elliot speaks, a hanging curtain against the wall is parted by Lee to reveal a stereo and some records. The offscreen Lee is looked at by him. As the stereo shelf is reached into by Elliot, grabbing a bottle of antihistamines, the camera moves back to Lee, who sits down on the bed. A book is still being held by her. Lee is walked over to by Elliot; a footstool in front of her is sat down on by him. She chuckles; with her, he smiles and chuckles. A carrot stick is eaten by Hannah as she enters the bedroom. As the camera stays with her momentarily, she walks towards Elliot and Lee. Holly laughs, and over to her, Lee glances, reacting. Embarrassed, her hands are put on her face as Hannah reacts and sits. Evan, listening, is looked at by them. Embarrassed, a victory sign is made by Hannah. Their laughter is tried to be suppressed by Lee and Holly. They are glared at by Norma. Hannah is wrapped with Elliot's arm; towards him, she is pulled affectionately and kissed on the cheek by him. Back, she hugs him. Some trays are carried out by Mavis the maid as the group starts to cheer and applaud. Her napkin is waved at April by Holly, then a wine glass is held up by her. As the group continues to cheer, they all toast Hannah. Smiling but embarrassed, her reaction is shown. As the guests sip their wine, they quiet down as Norma continues to speak. Their laughter is unsuccessfully tried to be contained by Lee and Holly. More food is served to the children by Mavis as she reenters the dining room. Her daughter is toasted by Norma; her lead is followed by everyone. The applause and cheers are begun anew. Chuckling, Hannah reacts. Elliot's hand is tenderly taken by Hannah as she looks around the table. Her shoulder is kneaded in turn by him as he chuckles with equal tenderness. Still embarrassed, at a plate, Hannah looks down. Once more the group applauds, toasting and drinking, and warmly sounding their approval. Classical string music is played as the film is cut to a taxi that is moving down Broadway towards the camera, passing a truck on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, and several buildings, and as the classical music still plays, the taxi is moved offscreen, and the movie is cut to the taxi's backseat. By the window, Lee sits, leaning her head in her hand, a reflective look on her face. On the counter of the loft's modern kitchen area, a cup of coffee is stirred by Lee; flowers are held by a nearby vase. Across the loft, with its high ceilings and beige walls, her coffee is held as she walks. Past a modern chaise, a bookcase, some sofas, and two columns, she continues to walk.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She flips through a book by a curtained window. Lee sets the book down on the desk and picks up another. She looks at offscreen Elliot and reacts. The camera shifts to a blushing Elliot as he crosses the room. As Lee speaks, Elliot parts a curtain to reveal a stereo and records, glancing at offscreen Lee. He retrieves a bottle of antihistamines from the stereo shelf. The camera returns to Lee, who sits on the bed, still holding a book. Elliot sits on a footstool before her. They chuckle together. Hannah enters, eating a carrot stick, and approaches them. Holly laughs, and Lee glances at her. Embarrassed, Hannah reacts and sits with her hands on her face. They look at Evan, listening. Hannah makes a victory sign, and Lee and Holly suppress their laughter. Norma glares at them. Elliot affectionately wraps his arm around Hannah and kisses her cheek. She hugs him back. Mavis the maid exits with trays as the group cheers and applauds. Holly waves her napkin at April and raises her wine glass. The group toasts Hannah, who smiles, embarrassed. The guests quiet down as Norma speaks. Lee and Holly try to contain their laughter. Mavis returns to serve more food. Norma toasts her daughter, and everyone follows. Applause and cheers resume. Hannah chuckles, taking Elliot's hand, and he kneads her shoulder, both chuckling tenderly. Hannah, still embarrassed, looks down at a plate. The group applauds again, toasting and drinking warmly. Classical music plays as the film cuts to a taxi on Broadway, passing a truck, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, and several buildings. As the taxi moves offscreen, the music continues, cutting to the backseat. Lee sits by the window, reflective. She stirs coffee in the loft's modern kitchen, near a vase of flowers. Lee walks across the loft, with high ceilings and beige walls, holding her coffee, past a modern chaise, bookcase, sofas, and columns.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She flips through a book by a curtained window, then puts it down to pick up another. She reacts to offscreen Elliot. The camera follows a blushing Elliot as he walks across the room. Lee speaks as Elliot reveals a stereo and records behind a curtain. He grabs antihistamines from the stereo shelf. The camera returns to Lee, who sits on the bed with a book. Elliot sits on a footstool in front of her. They chuckle together. Hannah enters, eating a carrot stick, and the camera follows her to Elliot and Lee. Holly laughs, and Lee reacts. Embarrassed, Hannah sits with her hands on her face, makes a victory sign, and Lee and Holly suppress laughter. Norma glares. Elliot affectionately wraps his arm around Hannah and kisses her cheek. Mavis the maid exits with trays as the group cheers and applauds. Holly waves her napkin at April and raises her wine glass. The group toasts Hannah, who smiles, embarrassed. Guests quiet down as Norma speaks. Lee and Holly try to contain laughter. Mavis serves more food. Norma toasts her daughter, and everyone follows. Applause and cheers resume. Hannah chuckles, takes Elliot's hand, and he kneads her shoulder. Embarrassed, she looks down. The group applauds, toasts, and drinks. Classical music plays as the film cuts to a taxi on Broadway, passing the Winter Garden marquee and buildings. The taxi moves offscreen, and the movie cuts to its backseat. Lee sits by the window, reflective. She stirs coffee in the loft's modern kitchen, with flowers nearby. She walks across the loft, past a chaise, bookcase, sofas, and columns, holding her coffee.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
She is leisurely flipping through the pages of a book while standing by a window adorned with elegant curtains. Lee gently places the book she has been holding down on the desk, only to immediately pick up another one with curiosity. She glances at Elliot, who is offscreen, and reacts to something he does or says. The camera smoothly transitions to focus on Elliot, who is blushing, and follows him as he makes his way across the room. As Lee begins to speak, Elliot parts a hanging curtain against the wall, revealing a stereo system and a collection of records. He turns his gaze towards Lee, who remains offscreen. As Elliot reaches into the stereo shelf, he retrieves a bottle of antihistamines, and the camera shifts back to Lee, who has now settled herself comfortably on the bed, still holding a book in her hands. Elliot approaches Lee and takes a seat on a footstool positioned in front of her. She lets out a soft chuckle, and Elliot responds with a smile, joining her in laughter. 

Hannah enters the bedroom, munching on a carrot stick. The camera momentarily follows her as she makes her way towards Elliot and Lee. Holly laughs, prompting Lee to glance over at her and react. Hannah, feeling a bit embarrassed, covers her face with her hands as she sits down. They all turn their attention to Evan, who is listening intently. Hannah, still feeling self-conscious, makes a playful victory sign. Lee and Holly try to stifle their laughter, but Norma gives them a disapproving glare. Elliot affectionately wraps his arm around Hannah, pulling her closer to him and planting a gentle kiss on her cheek. She responds by hugging him back warmly. Mavis, the maid, exits the room, carrying several trays, as the group begins to cheer and applaud enthusiastically. Holly waves her napkin at April and then raises her wine glass in a toast. The group continues their cheerful celebration, all toasting to Hannah. She reacts with a smile, though she is clearly a bit embarrassed by the attention. As the guests sip their wine, they gradually quiet down, allowing Norma to continue speaking. Lee and Holly struggle to contain their laughter once more. Mavis reenters the dining room to serve additional food to the children. Norma raises a toast to her daughter, and everyone follows suit. The applause and cheers start up again with renewed vigor. Hannah, reacting to the moment, chuckles softly. She tenderly takes Elliot's hand, glancing around the table. He responds by gently kneading her shoulder, sharing in the tender moment with a chuckle. Hannah, still feeling a bit embarrassed, looks down at her plate. The group applauds once more, raising their glasses in a toast and drinking, expressing their warm approval. 

As classical string music plays, the film transitions to a scene of a taxi moving down Broadway towards the camera. It passes a truck on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising the musical Cats, and several buildings. As the taxi moves offscreen, with the classical music still playing, the movie cuts to the backseat of the taxi. Lee is seated by the window, her head resting in her hand, a reflective expression on her face. In the loft's modern kitchen area, Lee stirs a cup of coffee on the counter, where a nearby vase holds a bouquet of flowers. She walks across the loft, which features high ceilings and beige walls, holding her coffee cup. Lee continues her walk, passing by a modern chaise, a bookcase filled with books, some comfortable sofas, and two sturdy columns.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In a leisurely manner, she is casually flipping through the pages of a captivating book while standing near a window beautifully adorned with elegant curtains that add a touch of sophistication to the scene. Lee gently places the book she has been holding onto the desk, only to immediately pick up another one with a renewed sense of curiosity and interest. Her eyes glance towards Elliot, who remains offscreen, and she reacts to something he does or says, though the nature of it is left to our imagination. The camera smoothly shifts its focus to center on Elliot, who is noticeably blushing, and it follows him as he makes his way across the cozy room. Just as Lee begins to speak thoughtfully, Elliot parts a hanging curtain draped against the wall, thereby revealing a well-kept stereo system and an impressive collection of records. He turns his attentive gaze towards Lee, who still remains offscreen. As Elliot reaches into the stereo shelf, he retrieves a bottle of antihistamines, and the camera transitions back to Lee, who has now comfortably settled herself on the inviting bed, still holding a book gently in her hands. With a friendly demeanor, Elliot approaches Lee and takes a seat on a footstool that has been positioned in front of her. She lets out a soft chuckle, and Elliot, sharing in the moment, responds with a warm smile, joining her in the pleasant laughter.

Hannah enters the bedroom, munching cheerfully on a crunchy carrot stick. The camera momentarily follows her as she makes her way towards Elliot and Lee, capturing the casual dynamic of the group. Holly laughs in a lively manner, prompting Lee to glance over at her and react accordingly. Hannah, feeling a bit embarrassed, places her hands over her face as she sits down in an attempt to hide her slight embarrassment. They all collectively turn their attention to Evan, who is listening intently, displaying a keen interest. Hannah, still feeling somewhat self-conscious, makes a playful victory sign with her fingers, a gesture that adds a lighthearted touch to the scene. Lee and Holly try earnestly to stifle their laughter, but Norma gives them a disapproving glare, hinting at her desire for decorum. Elliot, displaying affection, wraps his arm warmly around Hannah, pulling her closer to him and planting a gentle, affectionate kiss on her cheek. She responds by hugging him back warmly, enveloping him in a tender embrace. Mavis, the hardworking maid, exits the room, carrying several trays, as the group begins to cheer and applaud with enthusiasm. Holly waves her napkin in the air at April and then raises her wine glass in a celebratory toast. The group continues their lively celebration, all joining in the toast to Hannah. She reacts with a shy smile, though she is clearly a bit embarrassed by the cheerful attention. As the guests sip from their wine glasses, they gradually quiet down, allowing Norma to continue speaking uninterrupted. Lee and Holly once more struggle to contain their laughter. Mavis reenters the dining room to serve additional food to the eagerly awaiting children. Norma raises a heartfelt toast to her daughter, and everyone follows suit with genuine enthusiasm. The applause and jubilant cheers start up again with renewed vigor. Hannah, reacting to the special moment, chuckles softly. She tenderly takes Elliot's hand, glancing around the table with a sense of belonging. He responds by gently kneading her shoulder, sharing in the tender moment with a light-hearted chuckle. Hannah, still feeling a bit bashful, looks down at her plate with a smile. The group applauds once more, raising their glasses in a heartfelt toast and drinking deeply, expressing their warm approval and joy.

As classical string music gracefully plays in the background, the film transitions to an evocative scene of a taxi gliding smoothly down Broadway toward the camera. It passes a truck on its right side, while the Winter Garden marquee stands prominently advertising the famed musical Cats, along with several other buildings casting a charming urban backdrop. As the taxi moves offscreen, with the classical music still resonating, the movie cuts seamlessly to the backseat of the taxi. Lee is seated comfortably by the window, her head resting gently in her hand, a reflective and thoughtful expression etched on her face. In the bright, modern kitchen area of the loft, Lee stirs a cup of coffee on the counter, where a nearby vase holds a stunning bouquet of fresh flowers. She strides gracefully across the spacious loft, characterized by its high ceilings and beige-colored walls, holding her steaming coffee cup. Lee continues her walk, passing by a modern chaise, a bookcase filled with a myriad of books, some comfortable, inviting sofas, and two sturdy columns that add to the architectural beauty of the loft.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She is seated by a curtained window, her fingers gently flipping through the pages of a book, her eyes scanning the text with quiet concentration. After a moment, Lee places the book she has been holding down on the desk with a soft thud, only to reach out and pick up another one, her curiosity leading her to explore its contents. Her gaze shifts to the offscreen Elliot, and she reacts with a subtle change in her expression. The camera smoothly transitions to capture Elliot, who is blushing slightly, and it follows him as he walks across the room with a purposeful stride. As Lee begins to speak, Elliot approaches a hanging curtain against the wall, his hand reaching out to part it, revealing a stereo and a collection of records hidden behind it. He glances back at the offscreen Lee, seeking her reaction. Elliot then reaches inside the stereo shelf, his fingers deftly locating and grabbing a bottle of antihistamines. The camera shifts back to Lee, who has now settled onto the bed, still holding a book in her hands. Elliot makes his way over to Lee, choosing a footstool in front of her to sit down. She lets out a soft chuckle, and Elliot, catching her amusement, smiles and joins in with a chuckle of his own. Just then, Hannah enters the bedroom, munching on a carrot stick, and the camera momentarily follows her as she approaches Elliot and Lee. Holly's laughter fills the room, prompting Lee to glance over at her, reacting to the sound. Hannah, feeling a wave of embarrassment, covers her face with her hands. The group turns their attention to Evan, listening intently. Despite her embarrassment, Hannah makes a playful victory sign with her fingers. Lee and Holly exchange glances, trying to suppress their laughter, but Norma's glare reminds them to maintain decorum. Elliot affectionately wraps his arm around Hannah, pulling her close and planting a gentle kiss on her cheek, to which she responds by hugging him back warmly. Mavis, the maid, exits the room, balancing trays in her hands, as the group erupts into cheers and applause. Holly waves her napkin playfully at April before raising her wine glass in a celebratory toast. The group continues to cheer, their voices mingling in a joyful chorus as they toast to Hannah, who reacts with a smile, her cheeks tinged with embarrassment. As the guests sip their wine, the room gradually quiets down, allowing Norma to continue speaking. Lee and Holly, despite their best efforts, find it difficult to contain their laughter. Mavis reenters the dining room, her presence marked by the clinking of dishes as she serves more food to the children. Norma raises her glass in a toast to her daughter, and everyone follows suit, their glasses clinking in unison. The applause and cheers swell once more, filling the room with warmth and approval. Hannah, reacting to the attention, chuckles softly. She reaches out to tenderly take Elliot's hand, her eyes scanning the table, and he responds by gently kneading her shoulder, his chuckle mirroring her tenderness. Still feeling a touch of embarrassment, Hannah lowers her gaze to a plate in front of her. The group applauds again, their toasts and drinks punctuating the air with a sense of camaraderie and celebration. As classical string music begins to play, the scene transitions to a taxi moving down Broadway, the camera capturing its journey as it passes a truck on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, and several buildings. As the taxi moves offscreen, the classical music continues to play, and the film cuts to the taxi's backseat, where Lee sits by the window, her head resting in her hand, a reflective look on her face. The scene shifts to Lee stirring a cup of coffee on the counter of the loft's modern kitchen area, a vase of flowers adding a touch of color nearby. She walks across the loft, her coffee in hand, the high ceilings and beige walls creating an airy backdrop. Lee continues her walk, passing by a modern chaise, a bookcase filled with volumes, some sofas arranged for comfort, and two columns that stand as silent sentinels in the spacious room.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Lee flips through a book by a curtained window, then sets it down to pick up another. She reacts to something offscreen, prompting the camera to shift to a blushing Elliot, who walks across the room. As Lee speaks, Elliot reveals a stereo and records behind a curtain, retrieves a bottle of antihistamines, and the camera returns to Lee, now seated on the bed with a book. Elliot joins her, sitting on a footstool, and they share a chuckle. Hannah enters, eating a carrot stick, and approaches them. Holly laughs, causing Lee to glance over, while Hannah, embarrassed, covers her face. The group listens to Evan, and Hannah makes a victory sign, prompting Lee and Holly to stifle their laughter as Norma glares. Elliot affectionately wraps his arm around Hannah, kissing her cheek, and she hugs him back. Mavis the maid exits with trays as the group cheers and applauds. Holly waves her napkin at April and raises her wine glass, leading the group in a toast to Hannah, who smiles, embarrassed. As the guests sip their wine and quiet down, Norma continues speaking. Lee and Holly struggle to contain their laughter. Mavis returns to serve more food to the children, and Norma toasts her daughter, prompting renewed applause and cheers. Hannah chuckles, takes Elliot's hand, and he kneads her shoulder tenderly. Still embarrassed, Hannah looks down at her plate as the group applauds, toasts, and drinks, expressing their approval. Classical string music plays as the scene transitions to a taxi moving down Broadway, passing landmarks like the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats. The film cuts to the taxi's backseat, where Lee sits by the window, looking reflective. Later, in the loft's modern kitchen, Lee stirs a cup of coffee, then walks across the loft, past its high ceilings, beige walls, a modern chaise, a bookcase, sofas, and columns, holding her coffee.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She is flipping through a book by a curtained window, where the afternoon light filters through, casting soft patterns on the floor. Lee puts the book she's been holding down on the desk, only to pick up another one from a local author known for their poignant storytelling. She looks at the offscreen Elliot and reacts. The camera moves to a blushing Elliot, following him now as he walks across the room filled with an eclectic mix of vintage and modern furniture. As Lee speaks, Elliot parts a hanging curtain against the wall to reveal a stereo and some records from a renowned jazz artist of the 1960s. He looks at the offscreen Lee. As Elliot reaches inside the stereo shelf, grabbing a bottle of antihistamines, essential for combating his seasonal allergies, the camera moves back to Lee, who sits down on the bed. She is still holding a book that discusses the history of art. Elliot walks over to Lee; he sits down on a footstool in front of her, which is upholstered in a vibrant fabric. She chuckles; Elliot smiles and chuckles with her. Hannah, eating a carrot stick, enters the bedroom. The camera stays with her momentarily as she walks towards Elliot and Lee, her footsteps barely audible on the plush carpet. Holly laughs, and Lee glances over to her, reacting with amusement. Hannah, embarrassed by the sudden attention, reacts and sits with her hands on her face. They look at Evan, a mutual friend known for his humor, listening. Hannah, embarrassed, makes a victory sign that recalls her recent triumph in a local sports event. Lee and Holly try to suppress their laughter. Norma glares at them, her expression serious as usual. Elliot wraps his arm around Hannah; he pulls her towards him affectionately and kisses her on the cheek. She hugs him back, comforted by his presence. Mavis the maid exits, carrying some trays that hold the remnants of their afternoon tea, as the group starts to cheer and applaud. Holly waves her napkin at April, then holds up her wine glass. The group continues to cheer as they all toast Hannah, celebrating her achievements. She reacts, smiling but embarrassed by the attention. The guests, sipping their wine, quiet down as Norma, who is known for her eloquent speeches, continues to speak. Lee and Holly unsuccessfully try to contain their laughter. Mavis reenters the dining room to serve more food to the children, who eagerly await their treats. Norma toasts her daughter; everyone follows her, raising their glasses high. The applause and cheers begin anew. Hannah, reacting, chuckles. Hannah tenderly takes Elliot's hand as she looks around the table, feeling the warmth of the gathering. He, in turn, kneads her shoulder, chuckling with equal tenderness. Hannah, still embarrassed, looks down at a plate adorned with hand-painted designs. The group applauds once more, toasting and drinking, and warmly sounding their approval. Classical string music, a piece by Vivaldi, plays as the film cuts to a taxi moving down Broadway towards the camera, passing a truck on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, a beloved Broadway musical, and several buildings. As the taxi moves offscreen, the classical music still playing, the movie cuts to the taxi's backseat. Lee sits by the window, leaning her head in her hand, a reflective look on her face as she thinks about the day's events. Lee stirs a cup of coffee on the counter of the loft's modern kitchen area, where a nearby vase holds freshly picked flowers. She walks across the loft, with its high ceilings and beige walls, holding her coffee. Lee continues to walk, past a modern chaise, a bookcase filled with an array of novels and art books, some sofas, and two columns reminiscent of those in ancient Roman architecture.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Mavis the maid exits carrying some trays as the group starts to cheer and applaud. Holly waves her napkin at April then holds up her wine glass. The group continues to cheer as they all toast Hannah. She reacts smiling but embarrassed. The guests sipping their wine quiet down as Norma continues to speak. Lee and Holly unsuccessfully try to contain their laughter. Mavis reenters the dining room to serve more food to the children. Norma toasts her daughter. everyone follows her. The applause and cheers begin anew. Hannah reacting chuckles. Hannah tenderly takes Elliot's hand as she looks around the table. He in turn kneads her shoulder chuckling with equal tenderness. Hannah still embarrassed looks down at a plate. The group applauds once more toasting and drinking and warmly sounding their approval. Classical string music plays as the film cuts to a taxi moving down Broadway towards the camera passing a truck on the right. the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats and several buildings. and as the taxi moves offscreen the classical music still playing the movie cuts to the taxi's backseat. Lee sits by the window leaning her head in her hand a reflective look on her face. Lee stirs a cup of coffee on the counter of the loft's modern kitchen area. a nearby vase holds flowers. She walks across the loft with its high ceilings and beige walls holding her coffee. Lee continues to walk past a modern chaise a bookcase some sofas and two columns.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat is flipping through a book by a curtained window. The dog puts the book the cat's been holding down on the desk, only to pick up another one. The cat looks at the offscreen squirrel and reacts. The camera moves to a blushing squirrel, following it now as it walks across the room. As the dog speaks, the squirrel parts a hanging curtain against the wall to reveal a stereo and some records. It looks at the offscreen dog. As the squirrel reaches inside the stereo shelf, grabbing a bottle of antihistamines, the camera moves back to the dog, who sits down on the bed. The cat is still holding a book. The squirrel walks over to the dog; it sits down on a footstool in front of the dog. The cat chuckles; the squirrel smiles and chuckles with the cat. The fox, eating a carrot stick, enters the bedroom. The camera stays with it momentarily as it walks towards the squirrel and the dog. The bear laughs, and the dog glances over to it, reacting. The fox, embarrassed, reacts and sits with its hands on its face. They look at the horse, listening. The fox, embarrassed, makes a victory sign. The dog and the bear try to suppress their laughter. The owl glares at them. The squirrel wraps its arm around the fox; it pulls the fox towards it affectionately and kisses the fox on the cheek. The fox hugs it back. The rabbit the maid exits, carrying some trays, as the group starts to cheer and applaud. The bear waves its napkin at the penguin, then holds up its wine glass. The group continues to cheer as they all toast the fox. The fox reacts, smiling but embarrassed. The guests, sipping their wine, quiet down as the owl continues to speak. The dog and the bear unsuccessfully try to contain their laughter. The rabbit reenters the dining room to serve more food to the children. The owl toasts its daughter; everyone follows it. The applause and cheers begin anew. The fox, reacting, chuckles. The fox tenderly takes the squirrel's hand as it looks around the table. The squirrel, in turn, kneads the fox's shoulder, chuckling with equal tenderness. The fox, still embarrassed, looks down at a plate. The group applauds once more, toasting and drinking, and warmly sounding their approval. Classical string music plays as the film cuts to a taxi moving down Broadway towards the camera, passing a truck on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, and several buildings, and as the taxi moves offscreen, the classical music still playing, the movie cuts to the taxi's backseat. The dog sits by the window, leaning its head in its hand, a reflective look on its face. The dog stirs a cup of coffee on the counter of the loft's modern kitchen area; a nearby vase holds flowers. It walks across the loft, with its high ceilings and beige walls, holding its coffee. The dog continues to walk, past a modern chaise, a bookcase, some sofas, and two columns.

As Elliot reaches inside the television cabinet, grabbing a jar of jellybeans, the camera moves back to Lee, who sits down on the couch. She is still holding a magazine. Elliot walks over to Lee; he sits down on a pouffe in front of her. She chuckles; Elliot smiles and chuckles with her. Hannah, eating a breadstick, enters the living room. The camera stays with her momentarily as she walks towards Elliot and Lee. Holly laughs, and Lee glances over to her, reacting. Hannah, embarrassed, reacts and sits with her hands on her face. They look at Evan, listening. Hannah, embarrassed, makes a peace sign. Lee and Holly try to suppress their laughter. Norma glares at them. Elliot wraps his arm around Hannah; he pulls her towards him affectionately and kisses her on the forehead. She hugs him back. Mavis the butler exits, carrying some platters, as the group starts to cheer and applaud. Holly waves her scarf at April, then holds up her juice glass. The group continues to cheer as they all toast Hannah. She reacts, smiling but embarrassed. The guests, sipping their juice, quiet down as Norma continues to speak. Lee and Holly unsuccessfully try to contain their laughter. Mavis reenters the sitting area to serve more desserts to the teenagers. Norma toasts her niece; everyone follows her. The applause and cheers begin anew. Hannah, reacting, chuckles. Hannah tenderly takes Elliot's hand as she looks around the buffet. He, in turn, kneads her elbow, chuckling with equal tenderness. Hannah, still embarrassed, looks down at a saucer. The group applauds once more, toasting and drinking, and warmly sounding their approval. Jazz music plays as the film cuts to a bicycle moving down Fifth Avenue towards the camera, passing a motorcycle on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Les Misérables, and several shops, and as the bicycle moves offscreen, the jazz music still playing, the movie cuts to the bicycle's backseat. Lee sits by the handlebars, leaning her head in her hand, a reflective look on her face. Lee stirs a teacup on the counter of the loft's rustic kitchen area; a nearby pot holds herbs. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She is sipping a drink by a curtained window. Lee drops the book she's been holding on the desk, only to gaze out thoughtfully. She gestures at the offscreen Elliot and frowns. The camera zooms to a blushing Elliot, following him now as he dances across the room. As Lee whispers, Elliot flicks open a hanging curtain against the wall to showcase a stereo and some records. He glances at the offscreen Lee. As Elliot leans inside the stereo shelf, grasping a bottle of antihistamines, the camera shifts back to Lee, who reclines on the bed. She is still clutching a book. Elliot leaps over to Lee; he perches on a footstool in front of her. She sighs; Elliot grins and sighs with her. Hannah, juggling a carrot stick, bursts into the bedroom. The camera stays with her momentarily as she skips towards Elliot and Lee. Holly snickers, and Lee peers over to her, frowning. Hannah, startled, covers her face with her hands. They gaze at Evan, pondering. Hannah, startled, waves a victory sign. Lee and Holly struggle to stifle their giggles. Norma scowls at them. Elliot drapes his arm around Hannah; he nudges her towards him affectionately and nuzzles her cheek. She pats him back. Mavis the maid wanders out, balancing some trays, as the group starts to chatter and applaud. Holly brandishes her napkin at April, then lifts her wine glass. The group continues to chatter as they all salute Hannah. She flinches, grinning but flustered. The guests, sipping their wine, hush as Norma continues to lecture. Lee and Holly unsuccessfully try to control their giggles. Mavis reenters the dining room to distribute more food to the children. Norma salutes her daughter; everyone mimics her. The clapping and cheers commence again. Hannah, flinching, sighs. Hannah delicately shakes Elliot's hand as she scans the table. He, in turn, pats her shoulder, grinning with equal warmth. Hannah, still flustered, gazes down at a plate. The group applauds once more, cheering and sipping, warmly showcasing their delight. Classical string music drifts as the film jumps to a taxi crawling down Broadway towards the camera, overtaking a truck on the right, the Winter Garden marquee advertising Cats, and several buildings, and as the taxi drifts offscreen, the classical music still playing, the movie jumps to the taxi's backseat. Lee leans by the window, resting her head in her hand, a contemplative gaze on her face. Lee stirs a cup of coffee on the counter of the loft's modern kitchen area; a nearby vase displays flowers. She glides across the loft, with its high ceilings and beige walls, balancing her coffee. Lee continues to glide, past a modern chaise, a bookcase, some sofas, and two columns.

The applause and cheers begin anew. Jessica, reacting, chuckles. Jessica tenderly takes the microphone’s hand as she looks around the meadow. It, in turn, kneads her elbow, chuckling with equal tenderness. Jessica, still embarrassed, looks down at a notepad. The group applauds once more, toasting and drinking, and warmly sounding their approval. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She is scribbling on a paper near a shattered mirror. Tony tosses the paper he’s been holding onto the couch, only to grab another one. He glances at the offscreen Cameron and sneezes. The camera shifts to a laughing Cameron, tracking him now as he skips across the hallway. As Tony hums, Cameron pushes a swinging door against the bookshelf to expose a guitar and some hats. He grins at the offscreen Tony. As Cameron digs inside the guitar case, fishing out a bag of jellybeans, the camera shifts back to Tony, who lounges on the hammock. He is still clutching a paper. Cameron waltzes over to Tony; he settles down on a beanbag in front of him. He snickers; Cameron giggles and snickers with him. Valerie, munching on a celery stalk, dances into the hallway. The camera follows her briefly as she wiggles towards Cameron and Tony. Willow giggles, and Tony glances over to her, snorting. Valerie, bemused, snorts and twirls with her hands on her hips. They glance at Ivan, humming. Valerie, bemused, strikes a peace sign. Tony and Willow try to stifle their guffaws. Marcel frowns at them. Cameron wraps his leg around Valerie; he nudges her closer playfully and pats her on the shoulder. She pokes him back. Linda the gardener leaves, carrying some pillows, as the crowd starts to whistle and hoot. Willow waves her scarf at June, then raises her cookie. The crowd continues to whistle as they all salute Valerie. She snorts, grinning but bemused. The attendees, sipping their juice, settle down as Marcel proceeds to hum. Tony and Willow unsuccessfully try to contain their giggles. Linda reenters the kitchen to serve more fruit to the puppies. Marcel salutes her son; everyone follows suit. The hoots and whistles start anew. Valerie, snorting, chuckles. Valerie softly grasps Cameron's ear as she squints around the room. He, in turn, taps her elbow, giggling with equal softness. Valerie, still bemused, gazes down at a napkin. The crowd whistles once more, saluting and munching, and warmly echoing their enjoyment. Ragtime piano music plays as the film cuts to a bicycle zooming up Fifth Avenue towards the camera, jumping over a stroller on the left, the Metropolitan Opera banner promoting Verdi, and several edifices, and as the bicycle zooms offscreen, the ragtime music still playing, the movie cuts to the bicycle's basket. Tony leans by the window, resting his chin in his hand, a puzzled look on his face. Tony stirs a bowl of cornflakes on the table of the loft's rustic dining section; a nearby lamp holds candles. He dances across the loft, with its low ceilings and lavender walls, holding his cornflakes. Tony continues to dance, past an old armchair, a hat rack, some chaises, and three beams.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Lee flips through a book by a curtained window before engaging with Elliot. The camera follows a blushing Elliot as he reveals a stereo and retrieves antihistamines. He joins Lee, sharing a chuckle. Hannah, eating a carrot stick, enters, causing embarrassment as humor circulates among Lee, Holly, and the group. Elliot affectionately embraces and kisses Hannah, prompting cheers and applause. Holly toasts with her napkin, and the group acknowledges Hannah, who smiles despite her embarrassment. Norma's toast brings a quieter moment, although Lee and Holly struggle to suppress laughter. Mavis serves more food as applause and toasts for Hannah resume. Tender moments between Hannah and Elliot continue amid applause. The scene transitions to Lee in a taxi on Broadway, reflecting as classical music plays. She later stirs coffee in her modern loft, walking past elegant decor.
